Detailed Description

The plGraph class is used to obtain a a graphical representation of a joint distribution.

An instance of this class can be passed as an output parameter to the method plJointDistribution::draw_graph(). This function will return a graph equivalent to the description used to define the joint distribution.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

plGraph::plGraph ( )

Empty constructor.

This constructor defines a default figure border with a width and hight corresponding to a A4 paper where the orientation is not fixed (portrait or landscape).

plGraph::plGraph ( unsigned int  width,
unsigned int  height,
plGraphDesignType  the_type = PL_PAPER_SIZE,
plDrawingProgram  the_software = PL_OFFICE,
bool  fix_oriented = true 
)

Constructs the graph by using the specified window borders sizes.

The size of a node and the font size are computed automatically. The variable fix_oriented indicates if the dimentions (width and height) can be inversed to best fit the figure.

Member Function Documentation

std::string plGraph::get_distribution_label ( unsigned int  i) const

Returns the string labeling the distribution of the node, "P(S | K)" for example, where S is the set of variables of the node and K is the set of parent variables of the node.

std::string plGraph::get_label ( unsigned int  i) const

Returns the string labeling node i.

That is the set of variables on the node

bool plGraph::is_fixed_orientation ( ) const

Indicates if the graph has been set with a fixed orientation when it was constructed.

A fixed orientation indicates that width and height can not be inversed to better fit the resulting figure representing the graph. For example when using a A4 page it can be inversed (set in landscape) if the figure fits better in that way. A fixed_orientation equals to true will not allow to re-orient the given dimensions.
